conbody.p:
Pipeline Designertips for Data Collector usersThe
is closely based on the pipeline configuration canvas. Some functional differences are described below:
Authoring Data Collector When configuring a pipeline in , you select the authoring to use. You can use the system provided with for exploration and light development. To perform explicit validation or data preview, use one of your registered s as the authoring . Choose a registered that is the same version as the s that you intend to use to run the pipeline in production. Using a different version can result in developing a pipeline that is invalid for production s. For example, if you use a more recent version of for development than for production, you might include a stage, stage library, or stage functionality does not exist in the production . The registered must meet certain requirements to be used as the authoring . For more information, see Authoring in .
Copy changes to Control Hub > Pipeline Designer overview.
Create a Pipeline When you create a pipeline, you specify whether the pipeline will run on or , and you can start with a blank canvas or an existing template. provides several and templates as sample pipelines. You can use them to familiarize yourself with and pipeline designs or you can use them as a basis for pipeline development.
Edit a Published Pipeline When viewing a published pipeline, displays the pipeline in read only mode. The pipeline mode displays above the canvas as shown:
To edit a published pipeline, click the Edit Pipeline icon: . The pipeline then enters Edit mode.
Update Stage Libraries for the Pipeline When editing a pipeline, you can use the Update Stage Libraries dialog box to update the stage libraries for multiple stages in the pipeline. This allows you to update all necessary stage libraries at one time when you change the authoring for the pipeline. When preferred, you can also change stage libraries individually by editing each stage. The stage libraries that display for each stage depends on the authoring selected for the pipeline. For example, if the authoring has the MapR 5.0 and 5.1 stage libraries installed, then these are the stage libraries that display for a MapR FS destination or MapR FS File Metadata executor. To update multiple stage libraries at one time, click the More icon (), then select Update Stage Libraries. The Update Stage Libraries dialog box displays the stage name and type for each stage in the pipeline. On the right is the corresponding list of stage libraries for the stage that are available on the authoring . Update the stage libraries as needed, then click Update to save your changes.
Work with Versions When you have multiple versions of a pipeline, indicates the version of the pipeline that you are viewing. You can click the pipeline version to select a different version to view, as follows:
When viewing a published version, you can click edit to create a new version based on the pipeline in the canvas. For more information about working with versions, see Comparing Pipeline Versions.
Publish a Pipeline When you have completed work on a pipeline, you can publish the pipeline. After you publish the pipeline, you can create and run jobs based on the pipeline. Use the Publish icon to publish a valid pipeline: . After you publish the pipeline, it enters read only mode and can be used to create a job.
Create a Job After you publish a pipeline, you can create a job. You can create a job using the Create Job icon in : . Or, you can create a job from the Jobs view.
Data Preview Requirement You can preview data when the pipeline uses a registered as the authoring . If the pipeline uses the system or a selected registered that is not accessible, the Preview Pipeline icon () is disabled.
Validation Requirement You can perform explicit validation when the pipeline uses a registered as the authoring . Use the Validate Pipeline icon to perform explicit validation: .
Compare Versions When there are multiple versions of the pipeline, you can use the Compare with Previous Version icon () to compare the current version with a previous version.
In the Compare Pipeline window, you can select different pipeline versions in each window and navigate through the pipelines.
View Pipeline History You can view the history of the pipeline to see the commit history and the tags associated with the pipeline. Use the History icon to view the pipeline history: . For more information about working with the pipeline history, see Pipeline History.
Deleting a Pipeline Version When a pipeline has multiple versions, you can delete the pipeline version that you are viewing. Or, you can delete all versions of the pipeline. Use the Delete Pipeline option available in the More menu:
You can only delete pipelines or pipeline versions when they are not used in jobs.
